title: Detecting the dark sector through scalar-induced gravitational waves
authors: Xiao-Bin Sui, Jing Liu, Xing-Yu Yang, Rong-Gen Cai
abstract:
We investigate the evolution of cosmological scalar perturbations in the case
that the background radiation is weakly coupled to a light scalar field $\phi$.
The light scalar $\phi$ is a homogeneous background field with a large initial
value. In the radiation-dominated Universe, the coupling term introduces an
effective mass to $\phi$ and the background ultra-relativistic particles. The
oscillations of $\phi$ result in the periodic change of the equation of state
parameter and the sound speed, which provides a novel mechanism to amplify
subhorizon scalar perturbations through parametric resonance. The amplification
of scalar perturbations leads to a stochastic gravitational-waves
background~(SGWB) expected to be observed by multiband gravitational wave
observers. The observation of the SGWB helps to determine the initial value of
$\phi$ and the coupling strength of the interaction. This mechanism is
generally applicable to the interactions that introduce an effective mass, and
we take the interaction between $\phi$ and electrons as a concrete example to
illustrate the result. We find that under the condition that the coupling
coefficient $\lambda=10^{-16}$ and the initial value $\phi_i=10^{18}$ GeV, the
resulting SGWB spectrum is expected to be observed by the future observers
including LISA, $Taiji$, DECIGO and BBO.
